Wandering druids embrace the whole of nature rather than tying themselves to a particular grove. While she might stay for a night at an isolated farmhouse or briefly share a woodsman’s hut, she is likely to avoid settlements altogether, visiting animal populations instead. A wandering druid may have a major impact on an area she passes through without the human or humanoid residents even being aware of her presence. Her goals are to see all the wide variety of animals and plants the world holds (or as many as can be encountered in one life time) and to restore balance where nature is suffering. Thus she might take steps to put a stop to reckless slash-and-burn agriculture if it were harming a forest, advise farmers on better irrigation techniques in a drought, or introduce predators to thin the overprotected royal herd of deer.
